headline: Citi upgrades Dollar Tree, Dollar General: Call of the Day
summary: Citi analysts upgraded Dollar Tree (DLTR) to Buy from Neutral and Dollar General (DG) to Neutral from Sell. Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma sits down with Julie Hyman and Trader Talk podcast host Kenny Polcari on Market Domination to examine the analyst calls and the overall economic landscape for other off-price retailers. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: GM & Caterpillar downgrade, Dollar Tree upgrade: Market Minute
summary: Julie Hyman examines some of the top stories for investors as part of today's Market Minute. General Motors (GM) was downgraded by Bernstein to Underperform from Market Perform as tariffs continue to pressure the US automaker. Caterpillar (CAT) is in focus after UBS analysts downgraded the stock to Sell from Neutral, citing the impact of macro headwinds. Dollar Tree (DLTR) stock is climbing after being upgraded by Citi to Buy from Neutral. Similarly, Dollar General (DG) was upgraded by Citi to Neutral from Sell. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Dollar General, Mercedes Benz, JetBlue: Trending Tickers
summary: Yahoo Finance host Brad Smith takes a look at some of Monday's top trending stocks. Dollar General (DG) received an upgrade from Citi to Neutral from Sell. Citi also increased its price target to $101 from $69. Mercedes-Benz (MBG.DE) reported a 7% decline in first quarter sales, driven by lower demand in Europe and China. JetBlue (JBLU) was upgraded to Outperform from Market Perform by Raymond James, noting its low bankruptcy risk and strong potential amid negative sentiment in the airline sector. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here.

headline: Citi upgrades Dollar General as it has limited tariff exposure
summary: Investing.com -- Citi upgraded Dollar General (NYSE:DG) to Neutral from Sell saying the discount retailer is better positioned than peers to weather the new tariff environment and a potential consumer slowdown.
